column1: Smoque BBQ////While it's not the best BBQ I've ever had
column2: it's the best BBQ I've had in Chicago. This place embarrasses Urban BBQ
column3: which all suburbanites rave about: they don't know BBQ. Smoque
column4: which not only has the nicest staff you've ever meet
column5: has REAL BBQ. The brisket is nice and fatty
column8: and has a red smoke ring. The dry rub ribs are a unique addition to the Chicago food scene
column9: as people here probably don't even know you can order in such a way. I also love that you can order brisket "chopped" or sliced (for people who enjoy spice
column10: get the candied jalape√±os). My only real complaint is that they don't serve burnt ends
column11: which would be off the hook slow cooked here in their sauce.
